description.narrative: PIC stödjer det kambodjanska parlamentet med forskning, studier etc i syfte att stärka parlamentets kapacitet. PIC bedriver också olika sorters utbildningar för parlamentsledamöter.

PIC supports the Cambodian parliament to increase its capacity and play the role of a democratic parliament fully. It carries out training for Members of Parliaments (MPs) and conduct reserach for the MPs.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2014Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: During 2014, PIC produced 24 research papers for the Parliamentarians of the ruling and opposition parties from the National Assembly and the Senate to use in their work. 41 parliamentary staff members gained knowledge and skills in research and English through training provided by PIC. 5 parliamentary interns from the Secretariats-General of the Parliament completed internship programmes and gained knowledge in parliamentary research and outreach. 35 outreach activities were conducted for parliamentarians to enable public consultations and dialogue with the citizens in different constituencies, mostly attended by senators. In January 2014, a capacity building section was set up under the research department based on the recommendation made by the Swedish Parliamentary Research Services (RUT). A research training and curriculum was developed for building the capacity of the staff coming from Secretariats-General under PIC’s internship programme through the provision of English courses and parliamentary research skills.
The achievement of these results during this period is directly linked to the implementation of activities under the PIC’s core components of research, outreach, capacity building, institutional development, and corporate management and external engagement and collaboration. In late 2014, the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) decided to provide core-funding to PIC's programme for the period 2015-2017. This programme is jointly financed with Sweden.
Based on what is stated above, it is concluded that PIC has during 2014 continued to work in accordance with its plans, mission and mandate, and that the outputs achieved are logically linked to the identified outcomes, although it will take longer time before outcomes in terms of overall parliamentary capacity and efficiency can be assessed.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
